result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory S Bedford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
STRAIGHT TIME.
Consecutive to: Count 2

Probation may be transferred to Adams County.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
DNA costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims.
Victims to transfer title of vehicle to defendant upon receipt of monies from the DA's office.
Submit to a Mental Health evaluation.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - 1 day credit. (Condition Time-nonworking hours)
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion, as to Huber or Straight time.
Community service to be performed to offset the fine/costs; At a rate of $10.00 per hour.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Return of Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations to defendant.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Deceased

Defendant Gregory S Bedford in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 2 STAYED for 2 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 2 - Probation maybe transferred to Adams County 
- Fine totaling $1523.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with the victims. Mental Health evaluation.  Victims to transfer title of vehicle to defendant upon receipt of monies from the DA's office. 
- Defendant to perform 25 hours of Community Service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset fines and costs. 
 - 15 days jail - 1 day credit -  Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight Time to be used at Agent's discretion. 

Ct.  2:
- 6 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 STAYED for 2 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 1 - Probation maybe transferred to Adams County 
- Fine totaling $1523.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with the victims. Mental Health evaluation.  Victims to transfer title of vehicle to defendant upon receipt of monies from the DA's office.

Defendant Gregory S Bedford in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading Waived.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 and 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed by the State.

Defendant Gregory S Bedford in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Poulson states this is not going to a plea/sentencing today. Restitution is addressed. State responds.  Defense requests to talk to the State to work something out and requests another date. Court will give a plea/sentencing date and a jury status/jury trial date. Atty. Poulson to advise if the matter will proceed to plea and sentencing on February 4th at 2:00 p.m..  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court.   Defendant Gregory S Bedford did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was just handed additional discovery and needs time to discuss this with his client. Court will pass this matter until the defendant arrives. Case recalled. Defendant is now present. Defense requests another date for a plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
